At my current size, hard to believe if it wasn’t for the force. I won’t go that far again unless you are in physical trouble. You said. …..Thanks. She said.

Now, can I see a smile on that face? You said. Rey smiles for you. That’s better. Just one more thing, you said you’d be by my side no matter what. If I happen to walk down some dark paths, would you still be there? You said. Right by you. Sith, jedi, or criminals…. I’m right next to you. Whatever we become. She said. Just needed the reassurance. Don’t worry, I’m not going anywhere or doing anything drastic. I’m still not leaving you. You said. Thank you. She said as she pulled in in for a hug. Unless someone with two bigger orbs comes in. You said. Ha. Ha. Ha. I wonder if the airlock works while flying. She said. Joking! Joking! You said.
11111211212111111121111212.title: First kill

111112112121111111211112121.content:
Ok. We’re here. The smuggler’s moon. She said. What have you heard about this place? You said. Not a lot of good things. She said. This is a place to get lost in. Hey, with any luck, your parents might be powerful people with their own syndicate. You said. Oh, great. I’m part of a crime family. She said. If it’s true, you’d get anything you want and people will run from you when they see you. You said. I….don’t think i would like it that much. She said. Well, just in case…. You said. You bow your head to Rey. What was that for? She said. Just in case you are a crime lord’s daughter, I don’t have to worry about being killed. She said. Well it was a nice gesture, but I doubt I’m part of a crime family. She said. Only one way to find out. You said. I know. Just keep your head down. You might get sold here. She said. I’ll try not to stand out any more than I do now. You said. You tuck yourself away and Rey starts her search.

A lot of hustle and bustle here. Should feel right at home for you. You said. Except I’m not selling anything this time. She said. Speaking of selling, how many customers did you usually get? You said. On a good day, I’d get at least 7 people. Mostly smugglers and mercenaries, the occasional hutt, and a few off-world people. She said. You didn’t ask for an arm and leg, did you? You said. No lower than 50 credits. Girl’s got to make a living. She said. Rey starts to ask around about her parents; which starts to bring unwanted attention. I think we caught a trail. A Rodian said he overheard two people talked about their daughter they left on Jakku years ago. She said. Are they still here? You said. No. It happened long before we came here. They were in a hurry when they left. She said. We can use that. If we’re lucky, they left something behind that we can use. You said. Rey heads to the refugee sector.

A lot of people down here. You said. Let’s find where they were staying. She said. Rey looks into each one until she comes across one that is locked. This one won’t open. She said. Hang on. You said. You use the force to move the mechanism around to open the door. Presto. You said. You have your uses after all. She said. Heh. Cute. I’ll remember that one. You said. Rey looks around until she finds an old holocom. She plays it and a man in robes with a woman in robes start talking. You sure it was the right thing to do? Leaving her? She said. Not like we had a choice. She’s better off. He said. But just because- Keep quiet! They could be listening. He interrupts. The holo ends there. Not particularly crime syndicate looking. Rey? She said. You see Rey is silent with a serious look. Are you ok? You said. Rey says nothing as she picks you and leave the sector.

With your help, Rey was able to acquire a nice apartment with a view the lower parts of Nar Shaadda. A room with a view. Nice. You said. Rey plays the holo over and over. R…. No. I shouldn’t say anything. You said. …..All these years of wondering. Now, I’m looking for them and I’m still wondering. She said. You keep looking outside. The tone in my father’s voice…… Did they care? They just left me. They didn’t leave anything to tell me why. They just did. ……What do you think, tyne? You think they had a reason for leaving me? She said. You were a kid. What could you have done to make them leave you all alone? You said. Nothing. Maybe they owed someone, were on the run, or just didn’t want me. She said. Hey, let’s not jump to conclusions. We don’t know until we hear it from them. Let’s hear it from them before you decide anything. You said. …..You’re right. If….. When we find them, I’ll get what I want. She said. Hopefully, they will be answers you like. You said. Hopefully…. But after looking at this, I’m preparing for the worst. She said.

As you look out at the bustling city, Rey calms down some. She walks over, picks you up and kiss you. What’s this all about? You said. Thanks for being with me through this. She said. No need. You deserve to know them at least. You said. If they don’t want me, then fine. It’ll be just you and me. She said. Under the twin suns…. You said. You, me, and the endless Sandpeople. She said. Or we could go back to Naboo. A few wiped minds and we can live in the palace and the throne is yours. Wherever you like. You said. As long as you’re there with me, I’m fine. She said. Well, let’s leave the talk for a home after we find your parents. You said. You know, just holding you close to me, I forget about my parents and problems and feel I have everything I need. She said. That’s deep. You said. It’s true. Everything just disappears when I’m with you. I feel….wanted. She said. If that’s bad, I can up and leave like your parents did. You said. Rey laughs at your joke, which makes you happy. No. I like this feeling. I wanted just one person to care for me and you do just that without even being scared into it. She said. The first few minutes I was, but you were kind to me, so I could feel relax around you. You said. I didn’t want to run you off into the vast desert. She said. Heh. Made the right choice in staying with a lovely lady. You said. Lovely, huh? So what do you love about me? She said with a smirk. In general or specific? You said. Just name something. She said. Your kind attitude, toughness, put others first, the giggles in your sleep, the bear like yawn, and your passion. You said. So you do accept me for me. She said. Now what do you love about me? You said. Your thoughtfulness, putting yourself in harm’s way, caring, the talking in your sleep, and your…..underlying fetish. She said. Heh heh…. Again, sorry. That wasn’t suppose to happen during the massage. You said. But it did. And I don’t mind. I have my kinks, you have yours. She said. Well then, next time we have some time, we’ll have to explore each other’s kinks together. Mmm. I can’t wait. She said.
111112112121111111211112121.title: Docking at Nar Shaddaa

1111121121211111112111121211.content:
You want to keep that holo? You look angry every time you watch it. You said. I want to ask them. I want to show this to them and asked them why. She said. If they lie, do you want me to…. You know. You said. No. I want the truth willingly. If they lie to me, that shows they weren’t thinking about me. She said. They’ll have a chance to gain or lose a daughter. They better take it. You said. If they don’t, just me and you. She said. Wouldn’t have it any other way. Had enough of this place? You said. No need to stay. Unless you want to gamble. She said. I’d take the chance, but there’s not enough room on the ship for the credit haul. You said. With you in her hand, Rey heads back to the ship and flies into space.

Rey had the ship on autopilot as she was just constantly watching the holo. (She’s watching that thing again. It must be eating her up inside.) You thought. Worried about her, you lift the holo out of her hands and place it next to you. I know. Stop watching. But I can’t. I just never seen them and this is all I have so far of them. She said. I get it, but watching this till your eyes fall out won’t making finding them quicker. You said. I just want to know so badly. …..What’s it like having a parent, Tyne? She said. There are the good times and bad. Someone who has your best interest at heart, unconditional love, there for you when you’re hurt. You said. Is it really as good as you’re making it? She said. Like I said, good times and bad. Some days you want to be close to them, other days, you want to be far away from them. Same with my mother. We had our good times, but we also had our bad. But we loved each other in the end. You said. I hope my parents at least loved me. Excuse me. She said. Rey gets out of her seat and goes through the sliding door. I…. No. Best to leave her alone for now. You said.

Rey had left the ship on autopilot for now. She wanted to be alone to gather her thoughts. You were looking out into space. Never thought I’d see space flight. Thought I had to join a military or become a pirate to see this. As you watch, Rey comes back. You ok? You said. Yeah. I just needed some to be alone for a while. She said. You still want to search? I won’t hold it against you if you want to stop. You said. No. Watching that holo made me want to find them even more. She said. Then I’ll be right here with you. I’ve got a few questions of my own to ask. Once you’re done with them. So where to now, captain? You said as you give a soldier salute. Before she could tell you, the ship is rocked violently. What was that?! You said. Power to the engines is gone! I think the ship was hit with an ion missile! She said. That means we’re dead in space. You said. Then you hear the clanking of metal against the ship. We’re being boarded! She said. Rey hides you under the flight control console. Whatever happens, stay here. She said. But- No buts! I won’t let something bad happens to you! Stay here. She interrupts. Rey hides to the side of the sliding metal doors. You can hear heavy footsteps. When the doors open, you see a heavily armored Mandalorian with a black-market pistol. The person was average height, but they were wearing a helmet and bulky armor. So you couldn’t tell if it was a man or woman unless they spoke. The person walks forward and Rey attacks them with her staff. The person staggers and Rey hits them a few more times. But the person dodged one swing and punch Rey in the face. The person then slams Rey into the cold, steel wall. When they held her there, Rey kicks with all her might to make them let go of her. When she’s drop, Rey picks up her staff, but is shoot in the knee by a pistol. Rey! You said as she hits the ground.

You watch as Rey drags herself to the flight console. Her hope was blocking you from view. Ugh…. W…what….do you want with me? She said. The person shows Rey a holo recording. The female human jedi has been spotted. We can’t take chances with her. Capture or kill her. The holo recording said. Do I look like a jedi to you? Where’s my lightsaber? She said. The person put the pistol to her skull, showing that they weren’t up for games. NO!!! You said as you run out from behind her and force push the person from Rey. The person hits the wall with a loud thud. Tyne! I said stay hidden. She said. I’m not standing by and watching! You said. You concentrate the force around Rey to heal her when the bounty hunter gets back up. Rey covers you with her hand, which makes you stop. With pistol in aimed, the bounty hunter comes close to Rey. You lift Rey’s hand up and make yourself known. Hey! Bounty hunter! Down here! You shout. Hearing a voice, the person looks down to see a small figure. Tyne, don’t! Rey said. I’m the force user you want! Me! Not her! You said. You prove it by pulling off a panel on the wall. Stop! Rey said. Let her go and I’ll do whatever you want. You said. Don’t even think about it! Rey said. Disregarding her, the bounty hunter grabs you roughly. You look up at the imposing person. If you hurt him.....! Rey said. The bounty hunter walks away with you in hand and hyperspace away.

Tyne…..! Rey said as she gets up. Rey gets to the flight control. I’m not abandoning you. She said. Rey was able to track the coordinates of the bounty hunter’s flight path. I’m coming, Tyne. She said.
1111121121211111112111121211.title: Hunted

11111211212111111121111212111.content:
So how much are you being paid? You said. The bounty hunter doesn’t respond. The silent type. I see. You said. As the ship flies, you remain calm and contemplate what will happen next. Can I at least see who my captor is? You said. The bounty hunter removes the helmet to show you. Under all that heavy armor was a lady. Her red hair was in a ponytail and she looked down at you with her emerald eyes. Why is it always the cute ones that are bad? You said. She turns back to the controls.

She was keeping a watchful eye on you. I’m a person of my word. I’m not going to try anything. You’d kill me anyway. You said. That still didn’t stop her from watching you every now and then. (Escaping isn’t possible. She wouldn’t kill me. She’ll be out of a cashcow. I’m too good to her. How am I going to get out of this?) You thought. As you were thinking of a way out, you are grabbed by her. You stand on her open hand as she stares down at you. Take a picture. It’ll last longer. A small human isn’t something you see everyday. You said. She pokes and prods you. Then she stops. You do this to all your bounties? You said. She drops you on the console before she looks at her datapad. (I can’t last against a bounty hunter. Even with force powers. Rey….) You thought. T….Tyne!? Rey said. (R...Rey?!) You said. Tyne! Where are you? She said. (Being held hostage by this bounty hunter. How are you hearing me?) You thought. I just heard my name being called. She said. (So I’m speaking to you…..telepathically?) You thought. I guess….. Where are you? She said. (Still flying. I have no idea where she’s taking me. I’m a little scared.) You thought. I’m following close behind. I’m coming for you. Don’t worry. She said. (As much as I joked about it…. I don’t want to be sold off. ) You thought. I won’t let that happen. I promise. She said. The conversation is interrupted by the bounty hunter picking you up.

What? You said. She looks at you and pokes you. Is that all you’re going to do to me? I’m not a doll. You said. Her finger traces all over you. As she was doing this, the ship comes to a huge exchange frigate. Didn’t think ships could get that big. The thing could start and end a war. You said. When the ship docks on the frigate, she puts her helmet back on and closes her hand around you. She leaves her ship and takes you to the bridge of the ship where a female human was waiting. Just from her looking at her, you could tell she was a high up in the exchange. Hunter. Where is the jedi? She said. The bounty hunter shows you to her. What?! A tiny human!? She said. The bounty hunter nudges you and you get the idea. You lift her pistol from her waist. Wait….. This guy is the one we heard about? T….This changes everything….. In a good way. She said. She snatches you from the bounty hunter. The credits are being transferred to your account now. Plus a bonus for this discovery. She said. The bounty hunters turns and walks away.

So what’s going to happen to me? You said. What makes you say that? She said. I know you exchange type. You want something from everyone you come in contact with. So might as well come clean. You said. Let’s just say we have plans for you. But first, why don’t you tell me how you got like this. She said. ……Like I have a choice in the matter. You said. You tell her how you got like this. Hm. Interesting story. She said. No need to act interested. You’re just going to get rid of me anyway. You said. Jeez. For a jedi, you are a downer. She said. Who said I was a jedi? You said. Wait. You’re not a jedi? She said. Am I dressed like one? Do you see a lightsaber on me? You said. So you’re a jedi? Then there will be no question of morality then. Everything just got easier. She said. Morality, huh. Guess I’ll be doing questionable things. You said. (Not like it matters anyway. I’ve already killed. Can’t get any worse than that.) You thought. Then there is a loud blaring of the alarm. An intruder? Now? Security teams! Deal with it! She said over comms. After a few minutes, a exchange thug comes on comms. Madam! We lost three squads to the intruder. She cutting through our forces like an angry rancor! He said. Activate the defense turrets! Deploy the HK-47 droids! I want this person stopped! She said. Just as she said that, there are some blaster shots heard outside. After a few seconds past, you see Rey come in and the exchange lady pulls out her pistol.

You’ve got some nerve. Come onto my ship, killing my men, destroying my droids, and interrupting my business. She said. You think I care? I’m here to get back what’s mine. Rey said. The only thing you’ll get is a blaster shot in the eye! She said. Before she could shoot, Rey smacks the pistol from her hand and knocks her legs out from under her. Damn. Better not make Rey angry. You said. Rey takes the pistol and puts her boot on the lady’s chest. Whoa, whoa! Let’s not…do anything we might regret. She said. You are in no position to bargain. She said. Wait! I can give you whatever you want. Just name it. She said. I want nothing from you! Except one thing….. She said. Rey’s finger was about to squeeze the trigger.

She was seriously not happy with this lady. You did want to see her pay, but was this it? She’s probably done horrible things to people. No more horrible than what she was going to make you do. She’s exchange, so of course she has. But does that warrant a death sentence? You and Rey were better than this. Better than the exchange. Neither of you were like them, but you know the exchange won’t quit unless the risk too great. Should you let Rey kill her?
11111211212111111121111212111.title: Sold off

111112112121111111211112121112.content:
You say nothing and let Rey shoot her four times in the face. She won’t be needing this anymore. She said. This should send them a message. You said. If they know what’s good for them, they will let this be a lesson. She said. She picks you up and holds you close. Let’s get out of here. She said. Rey makes her way back to the ship. She places you in the other seat. Hold on! She said. Rey starts up the engine, flies out the hanger and hyperdrives away.

Are you ok? She asked. I should be asking you that. You braved mercenaries and droids to get to me. You said. I’ll be fine. I want to know about you. She said. A wounded ego over being exchanged so easily, but nothing physical. You said. She didn’t do anything to you? Hurt you in anyway? She said as she picks you up gently. (Went from cold hearted to caring so fast. Yeah, I’m not making her mad. But she really does care for me). No. Before anything could be done, A “angry rancor” started to slaughter people on the ship. With nothing but a staff. You said. I took a mercenary’s blaster and fought my way to you. I wasn’t going to lose the one person who cares for me to thugs and gangsters. She said. Heh heh. Guess we both can’t stand to see the other in a horrible situation. You said as you hug her check. I owe you….well, basically everything. You said. Your love is enough for me. She said. Which will make this next part easy. You said. What do you mean? She said. I want to say this….just in case I don’t get another chance. I know we have interest in each other, but what you did for me back there proves we aren’t just meant to be two people with a crush. No one has gone that far for me besides my mother. You said. What are saying? She said. You work up the courage to look her in the eyes. What I’m saying is that….. I don’t want to be just your lover. I want to be your significant other. You said. Rey’s heart skipped a beat hearing that. T….T….Tyne…. Are you….. She said. Yes. After what you did for me, no doubt. Would you do me the honor, Rey? You said. Rey’s heart was beating quickly. She’d never think something like this would happen to her. From the overwhelming feeling, she started to cry, but they were tears of joy. Yes…. Yes! I….would be happy to! She said. Rey hugs you tightly. Despite the pain, you just let her hold you tightly. After a few seconds, she knows she’s holding you tightly and lets go. So I guess we need to get you a ring. You said. I don’t want one. I have everything I want in you. As long as you know, that’s enough. She said. Rey gives you a long kiss.

So where to now? You said. Coruscant. She said. Home of the jedi order. Corescant’s a big place. We might not get as lucky like Nar Shadda. You said. We’re bound to find something. If not, it’s a great place to live. She said. If you have the credits. Luckily, you don’t need them. You said. I prefer a room with a view. She said. Is that an inclination of our future home? You said. Maybe. We’ll have to see where we settle first. She said. Whatever you want. You said. Rey flies the ship to Coruscant. The ship enter Coruscant’s atmosphere. Tall buildings, hustle of the city…. Try not to be overwhelmed. You said. I’ll be fine. She said as she lands the ship. Hmm. Looks like we landed in the upper parts. Good place to start. Ready? You said. Yeah. Come on. She said. She puts you down her chest. Rey exits the ship and starts walking and asking around. After an hour or so, Rey steps down an ally and pulls you out. Found out anything? You said. Nothing concreate. She said. We’ll find out something. You said. Rey tucks you back in and continues her search. When nighttime comes, You and Rey are look out at the jedi temple from her apartment.

Room with a view. Like you said. You said. Love it. She said. So anything new you found out? You said. I got a lead that the jedi temple has what I’m looking for. She said. The temple? Nobody’s been there since order 66. But I don’t think that will stop you. You said. It won’t. I’m not scared of any ghost or disembodied voices. She said. You think your parents might be jedi? You said. I have no idea. Won’t know till we get there. She said. If nothing, you could snag a lightsaber. It’d be better than the staff. You said. I don’t think I’d be any good with it. She said. You’re selling yourself short. From how I’ve seen you wield that staff, a lightsaber is a piece of cake. You said. .....A lightsaber does get someone’s attention. She said. You don’t need all that training. Just remember point it towards the enemy. Not you. You said. Ha. Ha. Ha. I’m going to take a shower. Try not to kill anyone while I do. She said. I won’t. You said. Rey heads into the bathroom. You stare out at the jedi temple. A jedi…. There’s so many contradictions in their philosophy. Yet they never questioned it. The sith are honest about themselves. But to constantly look over your shoulder isn’t something I like. Then again, who said I had to be either? I can just be some guy who can use the force and use it when I see fit. You said.

While deep in thought, Rey comes out from her shower. Tyne? Are you ok? She said. Yeah….. Just thinking….about some things. You said. She notices you staring at the jedi temple. Look. I don’t care who you ally with. Jedi or sith. I mean what I say. I’ll be there no matter who you become. She said. ……I know, it’s just….. What would you do if you had the force? You said. I’d do what I feel is right. She said. I just don’t want to regret the decision I made later. You said. Rey picks you up and place you in her hand. Tyne. Do what you think is right. I don’t care who you pick. I’ll be there with you and by your side. End of story. She said. ……What I think is right….. Ok. Thanks, Rey. You said. Don’t mention it. She said as she hugs you. She walks to the bed and gives you a few kisses. I love you. She said. I love you as well. You said.
111112112121111111211112121112.title: A proposal

1111121121211111112111121211121.content:
With the sunlight beaming on your face, you wake up with Rey’s hand over you. This time, when you try to get from under her, her hand closes around you and a smile forms on her face. This girl is getting smart. You said. She brings you to her lips and start kissing you. Ok. Are you really asleep? You said. Maybe.... She said as she open her eyes. Didn’t you want to go to the jedi temple? You said. I’m in no rush. I’m on cloud nine right now. She said as she pulls you to her chest and hold you there. So this is true happiness? I don’t want it to end. She said. Hearing her slow, rhythmic heartbeat makes you feel at ease. So does that mean the search is off? You said. I’m so tempted. I have someone who actually cares for me. Enough to consider me his wife. But we already started. Might as well keep going. She said. Rey gets up and places you on the bed. She takes some time getting dressed and undo her ponytails to lets her hair down. Ready? She said. Waiting on you. You said. Rey picks you up and tucks you away. She heads to the nearest taxi speeder and flies to the jedi temple.

The speeder gets to the jedi temple and Rey hops out. So this is the jedi temple….. Seen better days. She said. Rey walks up the steps and enters the temple. The inside’s no better. Destroyed pillars, staircases, lightsaber marks, blaster bolts. It was warzone. She said. Rey pulls you out. Just as bad as I thought it would be. Order 66 was no joke. You said. This place is massive. It could take a while to search this place. She said. I think we should split up to cover more ground. You said. What? She said. I know what you’re thinking, but this place drives people away. Nothing bad will happen here. Plus…. I want to see for myself how the jedi lived. You said. Is it even safe for you to walk around here? She said. I’ll be fine. Trust me. You said. ……I better see you again. I didn’t lose you to the exchange, I’m not going to lose you to this temple. She said. I don’t plan on dying in this temple. You said. Rey gives you a quick kiss for good luck and places you on the ground. I’ll go this way. You said. I’ll head upstairs. She said. You leave each other.

You squeeze through the small gap in the wall. This looks like a training room. So this is where they spar at. You said. You see some weapons that are old and rusted. I’ve seen these before. Force pikes. Usually seen among riot troops. Guess the jedi used them for the newcomers to practice with. You said. You move onto another part of the temple. Hmmm. This looks like where the member of the jedi council sat. All of them masters and very proficient. You said. As you look around, you hear a voice. Tyne….. It said. The voice sounded raspy, but powerful. Huh? Rey? Is that you? You said. No answer. I swear I just heard my name called. You said. You look around, but see nothing of interest and leave. You come into a big room with statues of jedi. These must past jedi. Like from the old days from the Galactic republic. You said. You look at each statue. Fine detail and craftsman work. Too bad it’s all crumbling down. If there is anything of value, then it wouldn’t be here. You said. Tyne….. The voice said. What the hell, Rey? You said. No response. If you’re playing a game on me, it’s not funny! You said. You look around and see nothing, until you hear footsteps. You turn around to see Rey, but she looks….different. Rey. You said. She’s wearing the same clothes, but they’re black and her facial expression…. It’s hard. Like she can’t smile even if she tried. Something’s….not right here. Rey. What happened to you? You said. She reaches for something on her side and you know what it is. She activates a lightsaber. You found one that works, but why is it red? You said. She says nothing as she starts running to you. You jump out of the way as slams her lightsaber into the ground. Hey! What’s wrong with you?! Why are you- Wait. This feeling…. A feeling of anger and hate. And those yellow eyes. You said. Rey pulls her lightsaber out from the ground. You…. You’re not the Rey I know! You said. She runs at you again, but you force push her away. (What’s going on?) You thought. Rey starts an imposing walk to you. (I can’t physically fight her. She’d slaughter me. Wait. Her lightsaber. I can use that.) You thought. You jump back when she tries to stomp you. I don’t know what’s gotten into you, but I’m not going to make this easy for you. You said.

She runs at you and you force push her back. She lands on her feet and holds out her hand. Your head feels hazy. Can’t….think straight. You said. Everything starts to spin around. (Calm….yourself.) You thought. You calm your mind and the woozy feeling goes away just in time for you to see Rey is in the air with her lightsaber pointed down. You throw a piece of a statue at her and hit her. She hits the ground hard, but gets back up with an angry look. Not easy as you thought? You said. Your feet leave the ground and you are pulled into her hand. Not good. You said. She tightens her grip on you. (Just like last time, she’s trying to pop me like a grape. If this keeps up, she will.) You thought. She puts her thumb under your chin and starts pushing upward. (Sh….She’s trying to pop my head off!) You thought. You had to think of something, but there was nothing you could do. You couldn’t get your arms free. As you were racking your brain to form some plan, you felt a tingling in your hand. Like lightning. Acting quickly, You send a jolt through her and the shock makes her drop you on the ground. Seeing the lightning raging in your hands, you electrocute her. She stumbles backwards. (If she just throws her lightsaber….) You thought. To stop you, Rey throws her lightsaber at you. Yes! You said. You use the force to stop it and throw it right back at her. She was ready to catch it, but you electrocute her to stop her. While stunned, the saber hits her right in the heart. She looks at you with an intense hateful look before she falls over and disappears.

You take in some deep breaths. I…won. But what was that? Was that a vision of her in the future? An alternate timeline? You said. You look at your hands to see small sparks of lightning move between your fingers. Force lightning…. I always dreamed of doing that, but now…. You said. With your new force power, you continue moving through the temple.
1111121121211111112111121211121.title: Dark side Rey?

choices: Some thugs ruin the good times
11111211212111111121111212111212.content:
You walk into a room with destroyed bookcases. This must be the library. All this knowledge…..gone. You said. You look at some pages on the ground, but most of them are unreadable from years of dust. As you walk around, you take in the battle damage. This library was completely trashed. I’m surprised the floor is still holding. You said. You try to find some readable pages or books, but they are all destroyed or unreadable. Not getting anything from here. You said. You leave. You walk the beaten halls of the temple. Nothing of use. I wonder if Rey had an easier time? You said. From your exploration of the temple, you get a good feel for the jedi. I guess with all the books, training, and force use, I can see why the jedi acted all high and mighty. Some even looked down their noses on common people. You said. You stop to look at the sprawling city. This place wouldn’t be bad to live. You said. You then hear footsteps. You look to see Rey walking the halls. She has a lightsaber on her waist. …..Lucky. ( Rey.) You said telepathically. Tyne! You’re not going to believe what a found. She said.(A lightsaber?) You said. Yes! I found it hidden in a crevice in the wall. It works too. Where are you? She said. (You just walked pass me. I’m on a ledge.) You said. Rey doubles back and comes to you. So this lightsaber…. You said. Rey pulls out the lightsaber and activates it. A blue one. You said. Yeah. Watch. She said. Rey takes a few swings with it. And is surprisingly great with it. Good, right? She said. Yeah. You moved like you used one before. You said. I think that’s years of using a staff. Hey, if I was a jedi, what kind do you think I’d be? She said. Well, I heard the color of the lightsaber represented what kind of jedi. Yellow meant sentential, green meant consular, and blue meant guardian. Given how you’re protective of me and others, I’d say a guardian. You seek out the evil and take it out. You said. I guess I would. She said as she holsters her lightsaber.

Anyway, did you find anything? She said. Nothing, but some unreadable books and statues of old jedi. You? You said. The archives were heavily damage, but I manage to find some records of people. She said. And? You said. I used the holoterminal in the archives and there was one jedi who stood out. Her name was Kerrryn Nel. She was a jedi knight who left the order to marry a man named Vessker Deabenk. The two meet when she was on a diplomatic mission. He was an adviser to the king of that planet. She said. Hmm. Maybe they named you Rey because you where there "Rey" of sunshine or something. You said. Very funny. The last known record of them was on Dantooine. She said. Do they keep records on all of the jedi? You said. Apparently. The archives were huge. It would take an analyst years to sort through it all. She said. So our next stop is Dantooine? You said. Yeah. She said. You and Rey leave the jedi temple.

On the ride back, you process what you saw back in the temple. That….thing back at the temple it was Rey…. But it was like her filled with anger and rage. The kind you’d only see in a sith lord. Red lightsaber, force, anger, and death grip. You said. You look up at Rey. Rey…. A sith lord? She’s too nice and caring for that, but….. What happened back on that cruiser. She did that with a straight face. Yet I didn’t stop her. So I guess I’m to blame for that. You said. The intense look flashes in your eyes. Did the temple showed me that to warn me? Rey’s going down a dark path? You said. You feel Rey’s finger poke you to make sure you are still in her cleavage. (Should I tell her? Everyone has a choice, including me. I don’t want to stop her from doing what she wants, but…. If the Rey I saw in the temple is an indication of what’s to come, then what pushed her to it?) You thought. As you were thinking, the speeder come to a stop. Rey gets out and heads to her apartment.

So city life….. Think you could adjust? You said. I think I’ll do just fine. We’re just missing the endless hoard of sandpeople. But this place is beautiful. A lot of things happened because of you. I never thought of getting out of Jakku and living in a deluxe apartment on Coruscant in the upper parts. She said. I didn’t plan on any of this happening. You said. Well planned or not, I’m happy we meet. And since we tied the knot, we’ll be happy together. She said. She kisses you, but this time she licks you with her tongue during the kiss. When she breaks it, all you could do was give a smile. I want to thank you for being here with me through all this. She said. Well, it was either that or stay on Jakku in an empty, destroyed AT-AT. Ah, I couldn’t let you do this alone. Not after all you’ve done for me. Plus…..i had a soft spot for sad girls. Can’t stand to see a girl sad. You said. And that’s the thing. You’re always thinking of me. Making me happy and all and not asking one thing in return. Ever since we first meet, you thought of me. She said. I’m not fishing for favors or anything. I’m just being me. And….you have a cute smile. You said. Stop it. She said with a red face. As long as you’re happy, I’m fine. I get your love and compassion. More than enough for me. I don’t want you jumping through hoops for me just because I’m no bigger than your thumb. You care for me, I care for you. You said. I know. She said as you jump onto her hand. Don’t worry about me. I’m happy to be with you. And whatever makes you smile makes me happy. You said. You know, I couldn’t ask for a better person. She said.

Look, we aren’t leaving just yet. Why don’t we enjoy ourselves while we’re here, and find you a place that serves food. You must be starved. You said just as her stomach rumbles. Wow, that timing. You said. I’m up for it. Let’s go. She said. Rey places you in her cleavage and pats you down. Comfy? She said. You give a thumbs up and with a smile, she leaves.
11111211212111111121111212111212.title: The library

111112112121111111211112121112121.content:
Rey lands the taxi in next to a fancy restaurant. This place is suited to the wealthy and politically connected. She said. (You sure about this place? It doesn’t seem like we’d be accepted.) You said telepathically. Yeah. Let’s see how the 1% of this planet indulge. Just do your thing, and anyone says anything out of line, I’ll deal with them. She said. (Ok.) You said. Rey walks up to the door and the usher lets her in after you “persuade” him. Rey is seated at one of the tables. She quickly pulls you out and covers you with her hand. So this is how rich people dine? She said. More or less. It’s all about who you know. If you’re friends with a influential politician, all door open for you on this planet. Or if you have the credits, you can buy in. You said. That simple, huh? She said. In theory, it is. Credits come and go on this planet like the wind. And as for politicians, they wouldn’t be caught dead with common people. Why do you think they stay on the top level of Coruscant. You said. Rey tucks you away just as a waiter comes up. I’ll try…..this. She said. The waiter nods and leaves and Rey pulls you back out. So how’s fine dining? You said. I feel….out of place. A club or cantina, yeah. But a high-class place like this, not even in my dreams. She said. Try to enjoy yourself. If someone gives you a hard time, let me know. I’ll make them treat you with the utmost. You said. After a few minutes, the waiter gives Rey her food. Hey. I’ve seen this on Naboo. Must be imported. You said. Whatever it is, it’s good! She said. Don’t forget to breath. You said. Rey hands you a few pieces as she eats. Damn. You want seconds? You said. No. I’m stuffed. She said. Rey gets up and leaves.

You both explore Coruscant and its beauties until nighttime. Ok. I got one. Would you have sold me the minute you saw me? You said. That depends. How much? She said. Credits to buy out a planet and still enough to for generations. You said. Yes. She said. Wow. You said that quickly. You said. Come on. Wouldn’t you want to help out a down on her luck scavenger? She said. Don’t you use those puppy eyes on me. You said. Rey giggles at you being worked up. I’m just joking. You’re a person, not a thing. She said. So you wouldn’t? You said. Not at first. She said. Rey! You said. Hahaha. Kidding, kidding! She said. Rey kisses you. Better? She said. I’m not so sure…. She said. Rey gives you a more passionate kiss. Now? She said. You’re forgiven. You said quickly. Now. Let’s enjoy the nightlife. She said. Rey hops into her speeder and drives it to the Uscru Entertainment District. Rey walks until she comes to the Outlander’s club. They rebuilt it after the CIS’s bold attack. You said. Rey walks in and sits at the bar. Keep ‘em coming till I say enough. She said. Rey gets her drink and downs it in one go. Rey had multiple drinks and was still able to see and talk straight. Rey, what’s your tolerance? You said. Let’s just say this isn’t my first-time drinking. She said. Drown your sorrows? You said. More than you know. She said. Rey eventually goes to do some gambling and comes out on top with seven thousand credits. I can’t believe it. You were up against high rollers and professionals and still came out with the winning. You said. With a little help from a certain someone. She said as she pats your head. I thought they knew you were cheating and were going to start shooting. You said. But they didn’t. And we’re walking away with their credits. She said. You and Rey spend more time in the club until Rey calls it a night and heads back to the apartment.

Rey walks into her apartment with you in her hand. So you wouldn’t become a dancer? You said. I have dignity. Dancing half naked with my butt out in front of strangers? Let the twiliks do that. She said. There’s a lot of credits. More there than scavenging. You said. I’ll live in my AT-AT for eternity before someone sees me swinging my body like that. She said. I see you like that. You said. That’s different. You know how I feel about you. She said before kissing you. What was that for? You said. For an excellent night. I’ve never lived like that before. She said. Anytime. If it’s ok with you, I’m going to hit the sack. I’ll see you in the morning. You said. You jump from her hand onto the soft bed and head to the pillow and go to sleep. While you were sleeping, Rey stepped out on the balcony to practice with her lightsaber. After some time passed, Rey come back in, takes a shower and lays right next to you. He looks so cute. She said. Rey gives you a kiss on the head. I know I thanked him, but I don’t think I can thank him enough. I know I sort of pushed him, but he didn’t hold it against me. I just wanted a friend and he did just that. He didn’t see me as some threatening giant or some lonely scavenger. He saw me just as a friend. So much so that he asked me to…..be his. We might have bad times together, but we’ll pull through. She said. Rey was rubbing you with her finger gently and gave you a soft kiss. I wish I could return you to normal size. But I love you any size you are. I know you have force powers, but I’ll still protect you. I won’t let anything or anyone hurt you. She said. Rey….. Like this? You said in your sleep. Heh heh. And what is that, I wonder? She said.

You were dreaming of you and Rey collecting scrap together. You were at your normal height and Rey was showing you how to strip an AT-ST. Like this? You said. You pull off a piece of the head armor. Just like that. You’re doing great. She said. I have the perfect teacher. You said before kissing her. Rey was watching you talk in your sleep, causing her to laugh. Must be a very good dream. She said. Rey brings you closer to snuggle you against her check. Rey then feels you hugging her check. Your hug made Rey smile. Sweet dreams, Tyne. She said.
111112112121111111211112121112121.title: Time together

choices: Someone followed the both of you
1111121121211111112111121211121211.content:
Rey opens her eyes to the sun light beaming on her eyes. Rey sits up and sees you in her hand. Rey pokes you a few times, but you don’t stir. Tyne, wake up. She said. T….ten more….minutes, mom….. The….empire can….wait. You said. So cute. But we can’t stay anymore. She said. Rey licks you with her tongue and you jump up. What!? Who!? Oh…. Rey. D…Did you just lick me? You said. Mmmmaybe. She said. I’m covered in saliva and only one person can do that to me. You said. Ok, you got me. I need to wake you up. She said. Well, I’m up now. You said. Rey gets dressed and head to her ship. Ready to see if you’re the daughter of a jedi? You said. I guess…. If I’m being honest, I’m more than happy with you. She said. So you’re calling it off? You said. ……No. I want to know why. What were they doing that required them to leave their daughter alone on an inhospitable planet? She said. You can sense a bit of anger in her. Then you remember what you saw in the temple. Tyne? Tyne! Rey said. Huh, what? You said. You spaced out on me? Something wrong? She said. No. I’m good. Let’s go. You said. Rey sits in the pilot set, starts the ship and flies it into space.

While Rey was flying the ship, you are in thought. (Should I tell her what I saw in the temple? Would she even believe me? She has a right to know, but….) You thought. (Stop her….) a voice said. (The voice…. It’s back. But I’m not in the jedi temple.) You thought. (Don’t let her find them…. Too great…. )It said. (Them? Her parents? And too great what?) You said. No response. (Damn voice….) You thought. In serious thought, you didn’t notice Rey was looking at you. Tyne. Tyne! She said. What? You said. You look troubled. What’s wrong? She said. N…..Nothing. You said. Rey puts the ship on autopilot, picks you up and holds you at eye level. Talk. She said. I’m serious. It’s nothing. You said. I can tell when you’re troubled. You go silent and don’t look at me. What is it? She said. It’s nothing to worry about. You said. When there’s something wrong with you, then it is something to worry about. Do I get mad or annoyed when you tell me something? She said. No. You said. Then just tell me. I won’t be mad or anything. If there is a problem, I want to help. She said as she rubs your head. …..When we were in the jedi temple, something was in there with me. You said. What was it? What happened? She said. There was a voice that called me, but there was nobody around. Not until I saw…. I can’t say. You said. Tyne, I won’t be angry. You are my husband. I don’t want anything bad to happen to you. I don’t like it when something happens to you. I want to know so I can help. Just…. Please Tyne. What is it that has you like this? She said with a concern look. (Mom…… You’d be proud of me for having Rey as my wife.) You thought.

What I saw was…..you. You said. Me?! She said. I don’t know what, but you were in there with me, but your whole persona was just dark and angry. You had the force and a red lightsaber and you….. You said. What? What did “I” do? She said. You…..tried to kill me. You said. WHAT!? She said stunned. You just came at me. You were almost successful except..... You said. You show Rey the lightning. Tyne. When did you learn that? She said. Back in the temple. If it wasn’t for this…. I don’t think I’d be here right now. You said. T….Tyne. She said. I still trust you, but I don’t know why that you was shown to me. You were just….full of anger. Like you became a sith lord. You said. Me…. A sith lord!? She said. That’s what got me in deep thought. You said. Rey remains silent for a few seconds. Why didn’t you tell me this then? She said. I….didn’t know if it was a trick or actual. But given how you were before we left…. You said. I know I’m not perfect, but being how you describe…. She said. Like I said, I don’t know. It could have been just a trick or it could be reality. You said. Do you think it will be me? She said. I don’t know. I’ve never experience something like this. I wanted to wait and see. You said. Rey sits you down in the co-pilot seat. Tyne. We’re in this together. So next time something happens when I’m not around, I want to know. Ok? She said. Got it. You’ll be the first. You said. Rey gets up and leaves. Don’t know if I made this better or worse. You said. You were waiting for Rey to come back when the ship arrives at Dantooine. We’re here, but Rey is still gone. Did I upset her that much? You said. You sit there for a few minutes and Rey still hasn’t come back. You jump down and go through the ship and find her in the cargo hold and sitting on a metal box. She looks downtrodden. I need to make this right. You said. You go to her and jump onto her boot. You start climbing up her leg and make it to her knee. You jump onto her arm, walk up her arm and jump up on her shoulder. You head to her face and touch her cheek. Tyne? When did you get in here? She said. A few minutes ago. You said. How’d you get right there? She said. I climbed you. You said you always wanted me to. I wanted to set this straight before we land. You said. Rey smiles, but she gets a serious look after a few seconds. You jump onto her hand and she strokes your back.

Look, if I came on a little too strong back there, I’m sorry. What you said sort of shocked me to the core. She said. I didn’t want to say anything until I found out if that was really going to be you. You said. I know, I know. Your heart was in the right place. But I’m here as well. No need to shoulder all the weight. She said. I didn’t want to jump to conclusions and stopping you from what you want. You said. What I want is you and me to be happy together. That’s what all I truly want. She said. So you don’t hold it against me? You said. I never did. You were just thinking about me as usual. She said. It’s what I do best. You said. Rey smiles and gives you a kiss. I can handle myself, but having someone watching out for me is alright. She said. She gives you another kiss. You and me, Tyne. She said. Wouldn’t have it any other way. The ship landed on Dantooine. You want to go now, or brood some more? You said. I’ve done enough of that. She said. Rey gets up from the box. Let’s go find Kerrryn. She said.
1111121121211111112111121211121211.title: Morning time

choices: Kerrryn doesn't have a good reason
11111211212111111121111212111212111.content:
Rey steps out of the ship and looks at the landscape. Wow. It’s peaceful here. She said. Yeah. This seems like a planet you come to get away from big population. You said. From just the looks of this place, looks like only a few people live here. She said. How about that house right there? We could ask them. You said. Got to start somewhere. She said. Rey walks up to the door and knocks. After a few seconds, a middle-aged woman opens the door the door. Yes? She said. Sorry to bother you, but do you know a Kerrryn Nel? Rey said. That’s me. She said. I have something to ask you. You married a man named Deabenk, didn’t you? Rey said. I did. Except he died a few years ago. She said. And did you have a child? Rey said. I did. Her name was…. Rey? She said surprised. (Jackpot.) You thought. Hello, mother. Rey said. The last time I saw you was Jakku. And you were just a toddler. But that was years ago. Kerrryn said. Yeah. Being left alone for years, you tend to grow. You and dad left me all alone on a desert planet. Rey said as she walks in. You didn’t even leave me a holocom as to why. She said. Rey. It’s not what it seems. She said. Then explains this! She said. Rey shows Kerrryn the holo. You sure it was the right thing to do? Leaving her? Kerrryn said. Not like we had a choice. She’s better off. Deabenk said. But just because- Keep quiet! They could be listening. Deabenk said. I’ve wondered for years why I was left alone. Not even a holocom to let me know why. What was so damn serious that it required me to be left alone!? Rey said. It’s not like…..we wanted to leave you. We…just didn’t have a choice. Kerrryn said. Everybody has a choice. Answer my question. Rey said. Jedi aren’t allowed to have children. After order 66, we thought Palpatine’s assassins would come for us. Even after his death, they would still come after us. She said. That was long before you had me. Don’t you dare give me lies! Rey said.

Ok, ok.... I'll tell you. Kerrryn said. (Better be a good damn reason.) You thought.
11111211212111111121111212111212111.title: Search for Kerrryn

111112112121111111211112121112121112.content:
Turns out the Empire wasn’t our only threat. The price on a jedi’s head is astronomical. Word got out that one was on Jakku. We knew what that meant. Bounty hunters from all over would pour into Jakku. We knew what to do. We had to leave Jakku. Kerrryn said. And why didn’t you take me? Rey said. We wanted to. We really did, but….. She said. But what!? What kept you from taking your only child with you!? Rey said. We didn’t have enough credits for a third. She said. So that’s why? You left me on that planet because of some credits?! You couldn’t have mind trick the person? You are a jedi, aren’t you? Rey said. Your father thought that was a good idea. You’d have a chance to live your own life. No fear of someone wanting to shoot you. She said. Did you ever think how that would affect me? Years alone. Growing up in a gutted AT-AT, no one caring for you, having to live by the skin of your teeth. Did that ever cross your mind?! Rey said. We didn’t think we’d hide long. At most, 4 years. But the bounty hunters kept finding us. She said. You had me think not a single soul cared for me. I was alone for so long until someone came into my life and was my friend. Now, we’re married. She said. Married?! Where is he? She said. Rey pulls you out and shows you to her mother. I…Is that a….. Kerrryn said. Yeah, I’m thumb sized, but my heart is bigger than yours will ever be. You said. His name is Tyne. He’s showed me what love and care really is. Rey said. How’d he….get so small? Kerrryn said. I’m not the one who needs to be questioned here. I heard everything. Credits, bounty hunters, all of it. You’re a mother. You’re suppose to care and protect your child. Being a jedi, that should be easy. You said.

It’s not…..as easy as you think. She said. Really? I can be carried in someone’s pocket, but multiple times I’ve put myself in danger to protect Rey. You said. Even when I protect him, he comes to protect me. Something you are supposed to do. Rey said. We were thinking about you. This was just the best way we could. Kerryn said. Leaving a child on a desert planet by herself with no relatives or no guardian is the best!? I think Rey would have taken her chances on the bounty hunters. I would have. Were you that scared? Rey said. We didn’t want you killed over a bounty on me. Kerrryn said. A jedi can’t take down some 2 bit bounty hunter? You said. You don’t understand. These are people who- You cut her off by eletrocuting at her. Don’t tell me I don’t understand! I know what it’s like to be hunted! I didn’t leave Rey high and dry like you did! You said. Tyne, there’s no need for- Kerrryn extends her arm and you are pushed out of Rey’s hand and into the wall.

Tyne! Rey said worried. I’m….ow. You said. You’re married to a sith? Kerrryn said. I’m no sith, but I’m far from being one of you cowardly, hypocritical jedi. You said. I did what was right. If I didn’t, Rey wouldn’t even made it to her 13th birthday! She said. You don’t know that. The only thing you know is how to abandon your child. I bet you didn’t even love Rey in the first place. You said. If I didn’t, I wouldn’t have her. I thought of my baby for years. You have no right to- Rey cuts her off by holding her lightsaber to Kerrryn’s neck. R…Rey? She said. Not another step forward. Rey said. Rey…. Just put it down. No need for something hasty. She said. Let me tell you something. Anyone who touches him, deals with me. I will not let anyone, not even you, hurt him. Rey said. Ok. I won’t. Just put the lightsaber away. Kerrryn said. You get to your feet. You alright? Rey said as you jump onto her hand. I’m fine. What do you want to do about this excuse for a mother? You said. I don’t have a mother. No mother does this to her child. Especially a mother who is a jedi. Why didn’t you get rid of me on day one? She said. All life is sacred to a jedi. She said. More hypocrisy. You said. Apparently, my life wasn’t sacred enough to you to be in it. Hope running was worth losing a daughter. Rey said before storming out.
111112112121111111211112121112121112.title: Not mother of the year material

1111121121211111112111121211121211121.content:
Rey sits in the pilot seat. You going to be ok? You said. I’ll be fine…. A lot of emotions back there. Buried inside me for years. All came flowing out. She said. If I knew you were going to be like this, I wouldn’t have pushed this. You said. No. It’s not your fault. For years i’ve wondered why. I had the chance to find them and I took it. Now I know why. She said. You know. The worst thing about looking for something is finding it. You said. It really is. I mean. Over a small amount credits, my parents left me alone on Jakku for years. And for what? Assassins? Bounty hunters? I would have respected her a lot more if she said they just abandon me. She said. As Rey was ranting, you notice a few things start lifting off the ground. And it’s not you doing it. Uh….Rey? You said. Leaving me by myself was the best protection they could thing of? Who thinks that? She said. Rey…. You said. I learned how to fight and handle a blaster, but still. Aren’t parents suppose to think of their kids first?! Rey said. You see more things start getting lifted into the air. Rey. You said. How do you come to the decision “Leaving my only child on a desert planet by herself is the best way.” ? How!? She said. Rey! You shout. Huh? She said as the things drop. Rey looks to see some things out of place. Tyne. Where you doing that? She said. No. You were. You said. Me? She said. As you were venting, things started floating. You said. How? Unless…. She said. You’re force sensitive. You said. Force….sensitive? Like you? She said. One way to find out. Try using the force on me. You said. You said. You sure about that? She said. Yeah. Go on. You said. Rey holds out her hand and you are pulled into her hand. So you are force sensitive. You said. I…I can’t believe it. But….. why now? She said. I guess your pent up emotions pushed them into the open. You said. Well at least one good thing came out of this? She said.

So. We found your mother. A can of worms, if I have my say. Where do we go from here? For starters, let’s get of this damn rock. She said. Rey powers up the ship and flies into space. Rey puts on the autopilot and puts her head in her hands. Do you want to be alone for a while? You said. …..I like to. Nothing against you. I just want to process this on my own for now. She said. As you say. You said. You jump from the co-pilot seat and go through the sliding doors. You head to the cargo hold and sit against a metal box. So Rey’s a force user as well. And I thought me being a force user was shocking. You said. You sit there counting the minutes go by until Rey walks in. Tyne? She said. Over here. You said. Rey sees you and sits by you. You jump onto her leg then into her open hand. So how was your brooding? You said. As good as any other time. I don’t want to be like mother. If that’s what being a jedi is, then they can have it. She said. Can’t say I blame you. You said. You were right. The sith are bad, but they are at least honest with themselves. She said. Can’t take that away from them. Horrible, but truthful people. You said. What about you? You came to a decision? She said. After what I learned about the jedi, that’s out the window. I’m not giving up my emotion, feelings, and passion just because they don't like them. You said. Becoming a husk? I’ll pass too. She said. And sith? You said. The lesser evil is still evil. She said. It is…. Maybe we don’t have to be either. Just two people living their lives. Not associated with either. You said. I don’t know. I feel….like I can be something more than just that. She said. Like? You said. I don’t know. I just….feel it deep down. She said. Well, you said you don’t want to be a jedi or sith. What do you want to be? You said. I never said I didn’t want to be a sith. I just said the lesser evil is still evil. She said. I’m…..not following here. You said.

choices: The...sink? Is that really a sink?
1111121121212.content:
You woke up a few minutes before Rey. The red-orange glow of the sunset pours in through the cracks of the AT-AT.
You're still laying on Rey's upper belly/lower chest, her hands blanketed over you like smooth, warm blankets, which would've been even better had he not been hot all day.
Both of you are completely naked at this point and soaked with sweat at this point. You can still hear the soft rhythmic beating of her heart in her chest and the soft sound off air entering and escaping her nose. At one point you swear you could have heard her whisper something.

"Island."


All things considered, you're grateful for your current circumstances. Things could've turned out much worse.

But the white noise coming from your new friend/lover, couldn't drown out the worrisome thoughts that echoed in your mind. The teleportation device took you across space, but you weren't sure about time. You left in 40 ABY and measuring time on a planet like Jakku would prove difficult.

ABY: After the Battle of Yavin.
It was weird to you that such a system of measuring time rose to prominence. From your home town, the rise and fall of The Empire was just a series of newscasts and the series of increasingly complicated tax reforms which disappeared after the Senate took over and loosened their grip on the galaxy. You never saw even a picture of the boogeyman known as "Darth Vader," and if not for the insistence of numerous credible journalists, you would have thought the whole thing was an urban myth. Perhaps it was.
What definitely didn't happen was the Luke Skywalker thing. A farm boy blowing up the Empire's planet sized super weapon with one torpedo? Even if something like that were possible, you can't see why it would be worth changing a calender that stretched out over millions of years. It's not even the first time that the rebels blew up a super weapon. You recalled two other times that the rebels blew up death stars, the last one even larger then the prior two.

Anyway, your mother was back in 40 ABY and you were here. The machine would've been able to track your path, but if you were in a different year there's not much that you could do. You worried about her funding being cut off right after you teleported. Or worse yet, what if she followed me?
What if she was out in the desert, at one inch tall, at night, all alone. There's no point in torturing yourself with the thought much longer, you couldn't do about it anyway.

You're so helpless, so useless.

Well, perhaps less useless than where Rey found you. Earlier today, her steps in the sand launched you and engulfed the air around you with sand. When she grabbed you and cuddled up with you the second time, the width of her hand extended from just below your knees up to your collarbone. If you had to guess, you'd have to be between 6 and 7 inches tall. At this rate, you expected to be as tall as two to three feet by the time you woke up, but you remained 6 to 7 inches tall.
Why would you grow that much over the day, but stop at this size? What if this was your size forever?

You were getting a headache from all this thinking and even the nude body of Rey could only be so comfortable for so long. You look up at the peaceful face of your sleeping friend. She almost are me, you thought. She's kind, she's helpful, she's adorable, but the instant you tried to treat her like a normal human being she popped you into her mouth like a snack.

She wants you to fear her.
She wants you to know that she can kill you any second
She's completely drunk off of power

She just got carried away, you assure yourself. This is a weird situation and who would have thought that she could actually have her impossible fantasy fulfilled. She knows you're a person and you're the only person she has.

Anyway, this nap had gone on for too long. Time to get up. You start wiggling violently and start tickling her belly with her feet. A smile emerged on her face, but instead of waking up she rolled over onto her side. You let out a yelp as you fall off of her and onto the bed.

Well, she's probably going to be there for a while. Might as well explore her place while there's still daylight.

You look around the room and decide to hike towards....
1111121121212.title: Reality Hits Tyne (and we get some worldbuilding)

choices: You go check out that sink you saw before
You go try to wake up Rey again
11111211212121.content:
The cold metal beneath your feet snaps you back to reality (opp, there goes gravity).

It didn't take too long for you to make it to the wall in question. Obviously the walk is shorter now that you're six to seven inches tall, but you suspect that this place must be a lot more cramped for your larger companion. Poor Rey, this place must really suck for a normal sized person.

"What was I doing back there earlier?," you think to yourself, randomly. The feet thing, you thought it was your idea at the time but... in hindsight something didn't feel right. You were never really into feet before, let alone licking feet, but Rey said she had unusual fantasies. You were sure that the idea came from her, but that makes no sense. Unless.... There were stories about what force users could do. Children's stories, about the Jedi's ability to make do what they wanted. Was Rey one of those-

Enough. You had a messed up childhood, you're into some weird stuff yourself. It's entirely possible that all this "that wasn't my idea" stuff is garbage. Rey has been more than a great host and all the setbacks have been worth it.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------
You walk along the counter, finally able to view the scratches. For one fearful moment, you wonder if Rey has a pet that she didn't tell you about. You really didn't want to think of some kind of desert creature waiting in the shadows to eat you. To your relief, you begin to notice a pattern to it. They're deliberate, they're organized.

They're counting.

Counting what though? Days? Weeks? Months? Year's?

Or what if it's not a calendar.
What if it's counting her victims? What if it's counting all the people she's killed? What if it's counting all the tiny victims she's eaten?

Stop that, you scold yourself. Stop that right now. Rey is clearly as caught off guard by your present circumstances as you are. She's not a killer, she's just a girl living in the desert.

Still, she seemed pretty eager to put you in your place. Pretty eager to bite you in half and swallow you whole.

The numbers cut into the wall disappeared at a certain point. There was space available for future marks, but there were also markings that were just beyond your sightline. You estimated that there were several thousand markings on the wall.

You hope it was measuring time.
11111211212121.title: Is This A Home Or A Prison?

111112112121211.content:
Yep, that was a sink. Hot/cold water, soap, everything you need to wash yourself off. There's even a rag that you're able to use as a towel.

Your massive lover stirs from her sleep as you're finishing up. She strolls over toward the sink and leans against the counter, smiling as you towel yourself off.

"I see you found the water."

"Did you seriously build an irrigation system in the desert?"

Rey blushes.

"It's not that as hard as you would think when you're living on a planet full of old imperial tech. Most stormtroopers carry a moisture deterioration radar for emergency situations. From there it's just a matter of digging and streamlining pipes. I don't know, the whole thing just came easy for me."

"Did you take the moisture radars from dead troopers or are you saying that you took these from the active duty ones patrolling the planet?"

"Yes," Rey said coyly, her mischievous smile growing.

I love this girl, one part of you thought.

I don't trust her, said another part of you.

"So I've been meaning to ask, what are those markings about?"

"Oh those?" She said, a slight tinge of panic in her voice. "That's just wear and tear from the sand storm."

Rey is a terrible liar.

"The sand storm got in here? And carved in some numbers?"

"Hey so I'm about to go take a shower, want to join me?" She asked, trying to shift your attention.

You weren't about to let her off the hook that easily. You needed to know about the markings, the feet thing, if she was actually going to eat you. If you let her sex appeal distract you, you might as well just be a slave to her forever. If she knows that all she has to do to keep you quiet is flash her boobs, then it's all over. Now is your last chance to be an actual human being and not a toy.
111112112121211.title: A Turning Point

The back and forth between the two was very playful, but Tyne's anger was bubbling just below the surface. Just get out of this conversation, he thought, then you can cool off and figure out how to talk about all of this stuff.

"Well," he shoots back sarcastically, "if it comes down to it you can just eat me raw."

Rey's smile starts to fade. "I'm so sorry about that, I didn't mean for you to get hurt."

"Yeah, you know I don't think I made it clear how terrifying that whole thing was. I almost died."

"Tyne I was just playing-"

"You seemed to really make it about you back there. I mean it wasn't 'hey Tyne, did almost getting eaten alive by someone who you thought was your friend mess with your head at all?', it was 'don't you die on me!' 'How could you do this to me?' 'Ve could you almost die?'"

Rey tentatively moved her hand towards him, but was nervous about touching him.

"Tyne, I'm sorry. We are friends, I'm sorry that-"

But Tyne was already on a roll.

"I've been shrunk, I'm who knows how far from home, I don't know what year I'm in, did you even ask about any of this?"

"I'm sure it must have come up at some point,-"

"Look I appreciate you getting me, but every second since you found me I've been a slave to your weird, kinky sex stuff."

"OH, AS IF YOU WEREN'T INTO IT!" Rey said, standing up straight over the counter.

Tyne, surprisingly, didn't back down from the massive girl yelling at him.

"Not the foot stuff! Not waking up to do stuff with your feet!" He yelled back. "I wanted to 'show my gratitude' and make you happy in general, but I'm not into foot stuff and I don't know why the hell I'd be thinking about wanting to thank you after you almost fucking *ate me*!!!!"

"Oh what!? Are you saying I'm some kind of witch or something? Like I subconsciously planted thoughts into your head or something?"

"At this point, I'll believe anything! You're into some kinky shit, I bet you're behind it!"

"This is absolutely absurd! Are you taking the piss? This has no basis in reality whatsoever!"

"What are the markings, Rey!? Hmmm? Are you tallying off all of your victims? Is this just another weekend hobby for you?"

"HAVE YOU GONE COMPLETELY MAD? YOU STOP THIS RUBBISH RIGHT NOW OR I'LL-"

"OR YOU'LL WHAT!!!!???"

Rey freezes. She realizes the empty threat that she was about to throw at him. She turns around and walks away from the counter..

But Tyne isn't done yet.

He walks to the edge of the counter and yells out at her.

"Or what Rey? Go on. Finish it. Say what we both know you were going to say "

Rey turns back around, but can't look at him. "I'm sorry Tyne.I didn't mean-"

"Oh of course you meant it! Why wouldn't you? We already were halfway there a few hours ago. Why don't you just finish me off right now?"

"Tyne please," Rey quietly begged as tears spilled down her face. But Tyne would have none of it.

"I can't have that threat hanging over me. My existence is already hell as is. So if you're going to kill me, just do it now."

"Stop this right now."

"Just finish me off now. Then you can go back to being the lonely, pathetic desert rat that you were before and I can be a decent appetizer for dinner."

"TYNE!"

Tyne looked down at the floor below him. It took him quite a while to climb up to the sink and he could just barely see the metallic glow of where he had been several hours ago.

Would a fall from here kill him, he thought.

Only one way to find out.

"I'll just save you the trouble," he said as he leapt forward over the edge of the counter.

"NO!" Rey screams as she lunges toward his plummeting body.

1111121121212111111.title: Rey Catches Tyne

choices: Tyne Comforts Rey (As Best He Can)
11111211212121111111.content:
She gently placed Tyne onto the counter, closer towards the sink to try and stop him from jumping again. Then her massive arms pulled back and rested on the counter, folding them and then resting her head on them.

The only sounds that could be heard were the sounds of Tyne trying to catch his breath and Rey trying to hold her tears back.

Finally Rey sniffled really hard and then spoke.

"So y-you wanted to know what those markings were?"

Tyne was too shell shocked at this point to say anything, so he just nodded.

"This isn't my home planet. This isn't anyone's home planet. Sorry, that's probably why I didn't immediately think to ask about your home. All of us miss home. But I don't know where my home is. My earliest memory is of my parents leaving me here. I've been doing this scavenging thing since I was little."

"I don't know when it started," she continued, looking at the wall, "but at some point I started counting the days that I was here. I don't know what I was thinking when I started, it's not going to make them come back faster. But I just had to do something to convince myself that progress was being made. That I wouldn't be alone here forever-"

Rey had already been holding back tears, but at this point the flood gates opened and she just started bawling. She buried her head in her arms and her whole body started shaking.

Tyne just sat there, still in shock. He was still scared and he never got satisfactory answers to his other questions. What if she was pulling this stunt to lull him into a false sense of security? What if he was experiencing Stockholm Syndrome?

Or what if this is just a lonely desert girl that just opened up to you?

She's big, she's terrifying, she might actually be crazy, but she doesn't know her own strength.

She went too far, but then he went just as far. If there's any way to fix this, he has to try.

As her crying started to plateau, Rey finally felt something on her cheek. For a good 30 seconds, Tyne had been full body hugging her face. Rey was touched, but mildly confused.
She pushed him away.

"So what, am I brainwashing you into feeling sorry for the pathetic desert rat?"

"No," he responds walking back towards Rey In spite of her sudden anger, "of my own free will I want to apologize to a friend."

"Wait what?"

"I got heated and I said some things that I didn't mean."

"But you were right!" She said through tears, "I was weird and creepy and used you as a sex toy from the second I found you."

"Oh absolutely, that was weird. But you kept me safe and I wouldn't be alive if not for you."

Rey stood up straight and gave Tyne a baffled look.

"Do you have multiple personalities or something?"

"I was right, but then I went and did something terrible. I was scared, I'm still a little scared. The powerlessness of this whole thing is terrifying. And I didn't think you got how scary this whole thing is. So when you were messing with me and you shrugged it off so easily, I was absolutely terrified by the sheer number of ways that you could accidentally kill me. I didn't just want you to know that I was scared and angry, I wanted you to feel it. I wanted to hurt you Rey. The project was pulled, and my mother was going to lose her job. So I tested it myself. Turns out it did work, but had a side effect. You said. Making someone small? She said. I guess…. They never gave a reason why it was too dangerous for human testing. They just said it was. …..So, crazy right? You said. It’s not as farfetched as I thought it would be, but it’s still shocking. She said. What about you? What’s your back story? You said. Uh….. W…Well…. She said. She’s hesitant to tell you. Did….something bad happen? You said. You could….say that. She said. Rey looks away from you. Do you want to talk about it? If it’s too much for you, you don’t need to tell me. You said. No, no. It’s fine. She said. Rey takes in a breath before telling you.

I….never knew my parents. The only thing I remember is being in this AT-AT. I’ve been here on Jakku all my life, wondering if my parents are coming back. She said. All your life? You said. Here. Let me show you. She said. Rey walks over to a wall of metal with a long row of tally marks. Wow….. You say stunned. I’ve been keeping count ever since I could count. I had to take care of myself. Scavenging was the only way. And this AT-AT was the only home I could have. Days turned to months, and months turned to years. They haven’t come back yet. She said. Not even a holo call? You said. Nothing. No call, no messages. It’s as if they just- Abandoned you. You interrupt. Y…Yeah. She said. Rey slides down the wall to sit on the ground. At least you had someone to worry about. I don’t even know if my parents are alive so I can worry about. She said. Man….. That blows mine out of the water. You said. So. Now you know about me. She said. You see she’s sad from talking about her past. Rey. Can I tell you something? You said. What? She said as she looks at you. If your parents just left you here, then screw them. You said. What….do you mean? She said taken aback. To just leave their daughter by herself on this planet. Those aren’t parents. No parent would leave their child alone by themselves. You don’t need people like that in your life. You’re way better off without them. You said. I am? She said. Yeah. Make your own credits, have your own place, you have all the necessities. I say you’ve done well for yourself. You said. Rey remains quiet for a second.

You’re right…. I am better off. If they haven’t come back by now, then they aren’t. Wherever they are, I hope they are happy. I have almost everything I need here. She said. Almost? What are you missing? You said. A tiny friend. She said. M…Me? You said. Anyone else thumb size? She said. I….don’t know what or how I can contribute. You said. You don’t have to contribute anything. Just don’t push yourself. She said as she got up. We’re going scavenging already? You said. Not with that arm you aren’t. Besides, no need to rush things. I say we loosen up a bit. She said. Like a few drinks at the cantina? You said. I think that teleporter gave you mind reading powers. She said as she pats your head. Rey walks to her speeder and hops in. Now. Where to put you? She said. How about the other seat? You said. I don’t want you flying out while a drive. Hm. I know. She said. Rey brings you to her…..

It was….unexpected. You said. That was the whole point of me doing it. She said. Rey orders a drink and takes a sip. Whoa! Taste stronger than last time. She said. So you can handle your drinks. You're walking in a straight line.You said. I’m a little shocked that you can handle drinking at your size. She said. 1122111.title: Cleavage

11221112.content:
You were running through the desert. Can’t let her get me! You said. As you where running, you hit something hard and fall over. When your senses come to, you see Rey standing over you. Found you. She picks you up roughly and dangles you in front of her. Does that arm still hurt? Let me take care of that. She said. Rey rips the sling off and tug on your arm. The pain is excruciating until she rips your arm off. You howl in pain as she laughs. Don’t die on me just yet. We’re just getting started. She said. I….thought you said…we were friends? You said. Ha! Why would I be friends with someone who I can pick up like nothing? She said. She then drops you and you land hard on the sand. You hold your hand over your missing arm to try to stop the blood flow. A shadow is cast over you and you look to see Rey’s boot coming down on you. She twist her foot, which grinds you into the sand. She lifts her foot off you and sees you are alive, but barely. I didn’t think you’d brake so easily. You look like your in pain. Let me….end your suffering. She said. You watch helplessly as Rey lifts her foot over you and comes down with tremendous force. You wake up sweating just as her foot made contact with you.
